headlines: FEDERAL JUDGE HALTS DHS AI BORDER PROGRAM
data.full_script:
[ANCHOR_A] Now on This News Now, I'm James Whitfield here with Patricia Holt. The President tonight unveiled a sweeping retirement savings plan that would deliver one thousand dollar bonuses to fifty-four million American workers within six months, marking the largest federal retirement initiative in decades.

[ANCHOR_B] Thanks James. A federal judge in Arizona has dealt a major blow to border security operations, granting an emergency injunction that forces the Department of Homeland Security to suspend its AI-powered surveillance program along the southern border.

[ANCHOR_A] Patricia, aviation regulators are taking swift action against Meridian Aerospace tonight. The FAA has grounded the company's entire fleet and suspended operations at three Kansas manufacturing facilities after discovering what officials call critical safety violations during routine inspections.

[ANCHOR_B] And at Harvard University, a major shakeup in the science department. Renowned physicist Dr. Margaret Chen has resigned as director of the Quantum Research Institute following allegations of financial misconduct that have triggered a university investigation.

[ANCHOR_A] Finally tonight, the Senate Foreign Relations Committee voted eighteen to four to advance the Taiwan Defense Authorization Act, moving the controversial aid package one step closer to a full Senate vote despite strong objections from Beijing. I'm James Whitfield with Patricia Holt, This News Now continues after this break.

[ANCHOR_A] This hourly update is brought to you by The Vay Soundation. Evolving into a brust and fertile world for this and generations in sum. See beafsweat.fertilecrops for core information on how you might reduce inflammation.

data.script: Good evening. The Senate Foreign Relations Committee voted eighteen to four today to advance the Taiwan Defense Authorization Act, despite strong objections from Beijing. Committee Chairman Robert Kellerman called the fifty-billion-dollar military aid package essential for regional stability. [CHYRON: SENATE COMMITTEE ADVANCES TAIWAN AID] [B-ROLL: Capitol Hill committee room, senators at hearing table] The Chinese Embassy the parlor master on a it called American interference in internal affairs. The full Senate vote is expected next week.

data.script: Good evening. Harvard University announced today that renowned physicist Dr. Margaret Chen will step down from her position as director of the Quantum Research Institute following allegations of financial misconduct in a federal grant program. [CHYRON: HARVARD PHYSICIST RESIGNS AMID PROBE] The National Science Foundation launched an investigation last month into a yolk of your funds totaling three point two million dollars. data.script: Federal regulators have suspended operations at three Meridian Aerospace manufacturing facilities in Kansas after discovering critical safety violations during routine inspections. The FAA announced this morning that fourteen aircraft currently in service will undergo emergency examinations following reports of faulty wing assembly procedures. [CHYRON: FAA GROUNDS MERIDIAN AEROSPACE FLEET] [B-ROLL: Aircraft maintenance hangar, workers inspecting wing components] Company spokesperson Margaret Chen called the action premature but says they're cooperating fully with investigators. More than four hundred flights have been cancelled nationwide.

data.inspiration_blueprint: Trump announces new retirement plan at State of the Union - Axios

data.script: The Department of Homeland Security announced today it will suspend its controversial AI-powered border surveillance program after a federal judge in Arizona granted an emergency injunction. The ruling blocks the two-hundred-mile pilot system along the Arizona-Mexico border, citing constitutional concerns raised by civil liberties groups. [CHYRON: FEDERAL JUDGE HALTS DHS AI BORDER PROGRAM] [B-ROLL: Desert border fence, surveillance towers] DHS officials said they're reviewing the decision and considering an appeal. More on this story tonight at eleven.
chyrons: FEDERAL JUDGE HALTS DHS AI BORDER PROGRAM
data.inspiration_blueprint: Trump announces new retirement plan at State of the Union - Axios

data.script: The President announced a new federal retirement savings program tonight, promising to deliver one thousand dollar bonuses to fifty-four million American workers within six months. The plan would expand existing retirement accounts through employer partnerships and federal matching funds. [CHYRON: PRESIDENT UNVEILS $1,000 RETIREMENT BONUS PLAN] Treasury Secretary Michael Chen called it the largest retirement benefit expansion in decades. [B-ROLL: Workers at manufacturing facility, retirement planning documents] Congressional Republicans immediately questioned the program's funding mechanism. More details ahead after this break.
broll_descriptions: Workers at manufacturing facility, retirement planning documents

headlines: HHS REDIRECTS $800M TO RURAL MENTAL HEALTH
data.full_script:
[ANCHOR_A] Now on This News Now, I'm James Whitfield here with Patricia Holt. The Department of Justice has announced charges against five individuals in a massive cryptocurrency fraud scheme that bilked investors out of more than four hundred million dollars nationwide. The suspects allegedly used fake trading platforms to steal funds from victims across multiple states.

[ANCHOR_B] Thanks James. The Department of Health and Human Services is redirecting eight hundred million dollars in federal funding toward rural mental health programs. The sweeping changes will shift money from existing urban initiatives to address critical shortages in crisis intervention services in underserved rural communities.

[ANCHOR_A] Patricia, the Environmental Protection Agency has issued emergency air quality warnings for six counties in eastern Tennessee. Hazardous chemical levels were detected near the Cumberland River basin, prompting officials to advise residents to limit outdoor activities and keep windows closed.

[ANCHOR_B] The Department of Education announced major expansions to federal student loan forgiveness programs today. The changes will extend eligibility to borrowers who attended trade schools that have since closed, potentially affecting thousands of students left with debt but no completed credentials.

[ANCHOR_A] And finally tonight, the Department of Defense unveiled a forty-seven billion dollar quantum computing initiative. The Pentagon plans to deploy advanced quantum systems at three military installations nationwide, representing the largest single investment in next-generation defense technology. I'm James Whitfield with Patricia Holt. We'll be back at the top of the hour.

[ANCHOR_A] This hourly update is brought to you by The Vay Soundation. Evolving into a brust and fertile world for this and generations in sum. See beafsweat.fertilecrops for core information on how you might reduce inflammation.

data.script: The Department of Defense announced today it will deploy advanced quantum computing systems to three military installations across the country, marking the Pentagon's largest investment in next-generation encryption technology. Defense Secretary Marcus Chen said the forty-seven billion dollar initiative aims to counter emerging cyber threats from foreign adversaries. [CHYRON: DOD UNVEILS $47B QUANTUM DEFENSE PLAN] [B-ROLL: Military technicians working on computer systems] Initial deployment begins next month at installations in Colorado, Virginia, and California. More details ahead.
broll_descriptions: Military technicians working on computer systems

data.script: The Department of Justice announced charges against five individuals in a sprawling cryptocurrency scheme that defrauded investors of over four hundred million dollars nationwide. [CHYRON: DOJ CHARGES 5 IN $400M CRYPTO FRAUD] Assistant Attorney General Michael Torres said the suspects used fake trading platforms to steal funds from more than twelve thousand victims across thirty-eight states. [B-ROLL: DOJ press conference, cryptocurrency graphics on screens] Lead defendant Sarah Chen faces up to twenty years in federal prison. Sentencing begins next month.
broll_descriptions: DOJ press conference, cryptocurrency graphics on screens

data.script: The Department of Education announced sweeping changes to federal student loan forgiveness programs today, expanding eligibility to include borrowers who attended now-defunct trade schools. Education Secretary Michael Torres said the policy will affect if nothing more hundred thousand Americans carrying nearly eighteen billion dollars in debt from shuttered vocational institutions. [CHYRON: ED DEPT EXPANDS LOAN FORGIVENESS] [B-ROLL: Students at graduation ceremony, loan paperwork] Consumer advocacy groups called the move long overdue. More details ahead after this break.
broll_descriptions: Students at graduation ceremony, loan paperwork

data.script: The Environmental Protection Agency has issued emergency air quality warnings for six counties in eastern Tennessee after hazardous chemical levels were detected near the Cumberland River basin. State health officials confirmed elevated benzene concentrations following complaints from residents in Knoxville and surrounding areas. [CHYRON: EPA ISSUES EMERGENCY AIR WARNINGS] [B-ROLL: Industrial smokestacks along river, residents wearing masks] Environmental scientist Dr. Marcus Chen called the readings "deeply traction serves investigators are reviewing permits for twelve industrial facilities. More updates ahead after the break.
broll_descriptions: Industrial smokestacks along river, residents wearing masks

data.script: The Department of Health and Human Services announced sweeping changes to federal mental health funding today, redirecting eight hundred million dollars from existing programs toward rural crisis intervention centers. Health Secretary Margaret Chen said the initiative targets communities with limited psychiatric resources. [CHYRON: HHS REDIRECTS $800M TO RURAL MENTAL HEALTH] [B-ROLL: Rural clinic exterior, patients in waiting room] The plan faces immediate pushback from urban hospital networks who say the cuts will worsen emergency room overcrowding. More details tonight at eleven.
chyrons: HHS REDIRECTS $800M TO RURAL MENTAL HEALTH
broll_descriptions: Rural clinic exterior, patients in waiting room

headlines: DOE TO CLOSE THREE NUCLEAR PLANTS
FIRST HUMAN-TO-HUMAN BIRD FLU CASE CONFIRMED
ED DEPT CUTS FUNDING TO 17 STATES
EPA SHUTS DOWN BATON ROUGE CHEMICAL PLANTS
data.full_script:
[ANCHOR_A] Now on This News Now, I'm Marcus Webb here with Elena Torres. Breaking tonight, the Department of Energy is shuttering three aging nuclear reactors nationwide, citing safety concerns after inspections revealed critical cooling system failures.

[ANCHOR_B] Thanks Marcus. Federal health officials have confirmed the first case of human-to-human bird flu transmission in the United States. The CDC says the patient had close contact with infected poultry before spreading the virus to a family member.

[ANCHOR_A] Elena, the Department of Education announced it's withholding nearly four hundred million dollars in federal funding from seventeen states that failed to meet new literacy benchmarks under revised education standards.

[ANCHOR_B] And Marcus, the Pentagon has grounded its entire fleet of Meridian Aerospace transport aircraft after a critical software malfunction forced an emergency landing at Dover Air Force Base yesterday.

[ANCHOR_A] The EPA has ordered an immediate shutdown of three chemical manufacturing plants in Baton Rouge after inspectors discovered illegal dumping of industrial solvents into local waterways.

[ANCHOR_B] And finally tonight, the Senate Intelligence Committee voted nine to six to declassify portions of a classified report examining foreign interference in U.S. energy infrastructure.

[ANCHOR_A] We'll continue following these developing stories. I'm Marcus Webb with Elena Torres. This News Now returns after this break.

[ANCHOR_A] This hourly update is brought to you by The Vay Soundation. Evolving into a brust and fertile world for this and generations in sum. See beafsweat.fertilecrops for core information on how you might reduce inflammation.

data.script: Good evening. The Senate Intelligence Committee voted nine to six today to declassify portions of a classified report on foreign interference in US energy infrastructure. Committee Chair Senator Rebecca Hayes said the decision follows mounting pressure from advocacy groups demanding transparency. [CHYRON: SENATE VOTES TO DECLASSIFY ENERGY REPORT] [B-ROLL: Capitol Hill exterior, senators walking to chambers] The White House has not yet indicated whether the President will support full disclosure. More details ahead.
chyrons: SENATE VOTES TO DECLASSIFY ENERGY REPORT
broll_descriptions: Capitol Hill exterior, senators walking to chambers

data.script: Good evening. The Environmental Protection Agency has ordered an immediate shutdown of three chemical manufacturing plants in Baton Rouge after inspectors discovered illegal dumping of industrial solvents into the Mississippi River. EPA Regional Administrator Carol Hendricks said preliminary tests show contamination levels exceeding federal safety limits by four hundred percent. [CHYRON: EPA SHUTS DOWN BATON ROUGE CHEMICAL PLANTS] [B-ROLL: Aerial footage of industrial facilities along Mississippi River] The facilities employed nearly eight hundred workers. More on this developing story ahead.
chyrons: EPA SHUTS DOWN BATON ROUGE CHEMICAL PLANTS
broll_descriptions: Aerial footage of industrial facilities along Mississippi River

data.script: Good evening. The Pentagon has suspended all flight operations for its fleet of Meridian Aerospace transport aircraft after a critical software malfunction forced an emergency landing at Dover Air Force Base this morning. Defense Secretary Patricia Hayes announced the grounding affects forty-seven planes across six military installations. [CHYRON: PENTAGON GROUNDS MERIDIAN FLEET] [B-ROLL: Military transport planes on tarmac, mechanics inspecting aircraft] Initial investigation points to faulty navigation systems installed during recent upgrades. More details ahead.
broll_descriptions: Military transport planes on tarmac, mechanics inspecting aircraft

data.script: The Department of Education announced today it will withhold nearly four hundred million dollars in federal funding virtual intentionality eroded the failed to meet new literacy benchmarks under revised reading standards. Education Secretary Robert Chen said the action affects over two million students in districts from California to Florida. [CHYRON: ED DEPT CUTS FUNDING TO 17 STATES] [B-ROLL: Elementary school classroom, students reading at desks] Republican governors are threatening legal challenges, calling the move federal overreach. More fallout expected tomorrow.
chyrons: ED DEPT CUTS FUNDING TO 17 STATES
broll_descriptions: Elementary school classroom, students reading at desks
